name: echolocate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of animals) to find the way using echolocation (= sound waves): We are studying the intricate mental circuitry that allows bats to echolocate. Humpbacks don't echolocate but might use their own sounds to help avoid large objects. See
echolocation
More examplesFewer examplesBaleen whales seem not to actively echolocate, although they are capable of producing short pulses of sound.Oliver (1978) demonstrated that a grey seal learned to use sound to navigate, although he did not find that the seal echolocated.Their inability to echolocate over longer distances contributes to their frequency of net entanglement.
